title: Marauders

intro.speaker: Roark
intro.line: Are you layabouts done collecting supplies? We don't have all day!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: No, sir. Progress is slow. These people just don't have much. Something about an uprising earlier...

intro.speaker: Roark
intro.line: Fools! I don't want excuses! Take anything you see, and if these bumpkins complain at all, cut them down! Because you can bet your armor that Senator Valtome will do the same to us if we're not done by the time he arrives!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Reporting, sir! A Crimean army is approaching from the southwest! It seems to be the Royal Knights!

intro.speaker: Roark
intro.line: Wh-what?! Crimea is moving against us?! Those backwater fools! All right. Keep working. I'll take several men out to slow their approach! Colonial fools... I'll teach them what it means to defy the empire!

intro.speaker: Kieran
intro.line: General Geoffrey! We've confirmed the presence of the Begnion army in the village ahead of us!

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: I would prefer to avoid a fight, but I suppose that decision is up to them. Let's hurry!

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Hey, did you hear? The Imperial Army is requesting Crimea's assistance.

conversation.speaker: Youth 1
conversation.line: Yeah, I heard! I also heard that the messenger treated our queen with no respect at all! Who do they think they are!?

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Shhh! Not so loud! Begnion is ruled by the apostle. They helped us when Daein invaded. It's only right that we pay back the favor by coming to their aid.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: But Begnion is fighting the beast tribes of Gallia. Why would we fight Gallia? The beast tribes helped us rebuild Crimea.

conversation.speaker: Youth 2
conversation.line: That's true, but come on! Think about it. Who would you rather side with? A land of beorc, or the land of sub...laguz? The answer's as plain as day. We side with the beorc.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Hmm... You have a point.

conversation.speaker: Youth 1
conversation.line: I'd choose Gallia over Begnion.

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Really?

conversation.speaker: Youth 2
conversation.line: But why?

conversation.speaker: Youth 1
conversation.line: The people of Gallia helped us rebuild the village, even though we're beorc. They even repaired the road to the farm that's up on the mountain. That wasn't an easy job, either.

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Yes, I remember. What was his name... Mordecai? He was strong, yet very kind. He looked frightening at first, but the children in the village loved to play with him. He was a wonderful man.

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: If the queen decides to answer Begnion's request for troops, we'd have to fight Gallia. How terrible would that be?

conversation.speaker: Youth 2
conversation.line: That's war, isn't it?

conversation.speaker: Man
conversation.line: Yes. I suppose it is, at that.

conversation.speaker: Lady
conversation.line: Hmm.

conversation.speaker: Youth 2
conversation.line: I wish we didn't have to fight anyone at all.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: It’s been one thing after another. First, the civil unrest, then the imperial invasion. I’m so sick of hearing about all of it.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: You and me both. I figured I’d be able to get in some me time now that Crimea’s peaceful again. Get a card game started or something...

conversation.speaker: Largo
conversation.line: You’re a Royal Knight. If the queen decides you should go sweep away ten or a hundred imperial soldiers, you should probably go do it.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Yeah... We’ve been ordered to mobilize, and I can’t think of any excuse to get out of it. Maybe I could pretend to be dead. Any ideas, Amy?

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: Don’t make General Geoffrey mad! You’re a Royal Knight! You better follow his orders!

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Amy! You’re supposed to HELP me! She’s obviously been spending way too much time with you, Calill.

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Well of course, you twit! All right, Makalov. It’s time for you to pay up and go.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: What!? But... I think my stomach’s acting funny...
That’s enough, you layabout!

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Oh. Hi, Marcia. Don’t surprise me like that!

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Makalov! I knew I’d find you here, slacker! You’re making the whole squad wait for you! Hurry up and head back!

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: I don’t know about all this. Fighting the Imperial Army means fighting my old comrades. I don’t wanna fight my old friends. You know what I mean?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: ...I think I see. You owe them money, don’t you? Isn’t that the real reason why you don’t want to see them, cheese breath?

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: W-when did you learn to read minds like the herons!?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: I can’t, you spineless sea cucumber! It’s just so typical of you that I guessed!

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Marcia, please. That’s quite enough.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: But, Astrid! It’s despicable!

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Look at how calm Sir Makalov is. He never gets irritated or upset. It’s the mark of a true knight. A good knight must know how to keep his cool on the battlefield.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Um. But... we’re in a bar.

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: Oh, I hope to be as good a knight as Sir Makalov someday! How I dream of that day!

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Heh.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: I don’t believe this.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: ...You don’t wanna end up like me, baby.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Oh, I completely agree! Who’d want to end up a clown-haired chowderhead?

conversation.speaker: Astrid
conversation.line: The love you two have for each other is so wonderful. I wish I had a sibling!

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Uh, sure...

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: I’ll sell him to you. Cheap.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Geoffrey. Please take this with you.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Why... this is a master crown! I am honored, Your Majesty. I will cherish it.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: I have been asking you to fight difficult battles against terrible odds.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Your Majesty, allow me to reiterate: that is exactly what I wish. No matter the task, and no matter the odds, I can only succeed at it so long as you depend on me. I am yours entirely, Your Majesty.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: I shall take those words to heart. Geoffrey of Delbray, you are truly my finest and mot faithful knight.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Thank you, Your Majesty.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Here are the war funds. Remember, Geoffrey. You will face the Imperial Army. Should there be a conflict, you must not be caught unprepared.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: I shall be prepared, Lucia.

battle.speaker: Roark
battle.line: Crimean soldiers! How dare you turn your weapons against us! You will pay for this betrayal. Men, burn these shanties to the ground! Show these fools what we do to traitors!

battle.speaker: Geoffrey
battle.line: Monsters! They're setting the village on fire! Knights, evacuate the villagers and put out the fires immediately!

boss.speaker: Roark
boss.line: Dog of Crimea! I'll crush you!

boss.speaker: Roark
boss.line: The empire will not forget this... Once our main forces arrive, they will slaughter you like cattle!

boss.speaker: Geoffrey
boss.line: I am Geoffrey, the commander of the Crimean Royal Knights. Do you command these men?

boss.speaker: Roark
boss.line: Knight of Crimea. You are clearly guilty of treason against the Begnion Empire! Do you understand what it means to send an army against us? You've just killed your people.

boss.speaker: Geoffrey
boss.line: You have been warned. Queen Elincia will not accept any further acts of violence or banditry within our borders! Withdraw your troops immediately, or I cannot guarantee your safe return! Decide quickly.

boss.speaker: Roark
boss.line: How dare you take that tone with me! I'll put you in your place!

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Good, the enemy's retreating. Knights! Stay here and help to fix the damage done to this village.

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: Good work, Geoffrey. You sent them running.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Lucia! What are you doing here?

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: I'm here to protect Her Majesty.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Superb work, Geoffrey. You have my thanks.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Your Majesty... Forgive me. I could not avoid a confrontation with the Imperial Army.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It wasn't your fault, Geoffrey. However...I'm afraid our situation continues to deteriorate. Lucia, I appoint you as envoy to negotiate a treaty with the commander of the Imperial Army. They might be willing to listen now.

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: I shall leave immediately, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Senator Valtome... I sincerely regret having to meet under these circumstances.

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Oh, I completely agree, Your Majesty. I never dreamed we'd suffer so much mistreatment from our allies. So, you've decided that Crimea will side with Gallia, and honor the alliance with those filthy sub-humans over ours?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: As I've said before, Crimea remains neutral. Crimea will side neither with Begnion nor the Laguz Alliance. That is my final answer.

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Ah, then please enlighten me... Why prevent us from getting what we needed? Begnion is your suzerain. You should be...delighted...to comply with our request for supplies. But instead, you launch an ambush and inflict horrible pain on us, your loving guardians. Now, Begnion is a patient parent, but I do hope you realize that your actions thus far have amounted to treason and sedition...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: You have violated our borders, stolen from my people, and inflicted harm upon them. I will not allow such actions within my lands, no matter who the aggressor may be!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: How quaint. Uwee hee hee... Your Majesty, do you know what the penalties are for the crimes you've committed? I can only assume you do not, or you would not so rashly endanger your life. But don't worry, Queen Elincia. Once Begnion has your crown--along with your head--removed for treason, I'm sure we will take VERY good care of your people.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Senator Valtome!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: I think, after the dust has settled, I'll place my portrait right over your throne-- ...Mmm-hmm. It was a pleasure chatting with Your Majesty. I am leaving now. She's all yours, General.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Your Majesty... Please forgive my superior officer's insolence.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Wait, I recognize you... You came to our aid some time ago, during the Mad King's War. General Zelgius, wasn't it?

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Yes, Your Majesty. This is the second time I've had the honor of seeing you. I sincerely apologize for my army's actions during the resupply operation. Please, forgive us.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: The Begnion Empire and the apostle gave us much support in our reconstruction effort. Crimea will always appreciate Begnion's generosity. However... Crimea and Gallia are allies. As such, we cannot take a side in this quarrel. Please understand.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: ...I understand, Your Majesty. Our forces will refrain from levying supplies while in Crimea.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh... Thank you for your understanding.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: However, I must ask you to agree on these two points. First, the Imperial Army shall be given leave to pass through Crimea toward Gallia. Second, we shall be allowed to engage the Gallian army in towns near the Crimea-Gallia border.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Excuse me?! This peace talk is meaningless. You will still do battle and spill blood within our borders!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: I'm afraid this is the best I can offer. It's sometimes necessary to cut your losses for the greater good. Please think on it. Tomorrow, my army will begin marching toward Gallia. If the Crimean army does not interfere, I will take it as a sign of agreement. Farewell, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: General Zelgius! Please wait!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Does the apostle know anything about this war with the laguz?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It's just very hard for me to believe... Is this war truly the will of the apostle?

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: ...That is not for me to answer, Your Majesty.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Then at least tell me this: is the apostle safe?

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: ...Excuse me, I must go.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: General...

narration: After Elincia's meeting with Valtome, the Crimean Royal Knights return to the capital of Melior, leaving the border villages between Crimea and Gallia completely undefended.

The Begnion Central Army crosses the border once more, but Crimea makes no move to march against it. Valtome sees this inaction as a sign of Crimea's capitulation to Begnion's demands. The Begnion forces occupy the Crimean castles and forts on the border with Gallia and prepare to launch their attack.

The Laguz Alliance finally makes its way back to Gallia, but word of Begnion's approach allows them no time for rest. The news that Gallia's ally, Crimea, has allowed Begnion to travel through its lands comes as a great blow to the Laguz Alliance.
